meanings.definition: One that takes or receives something.
meanings.sent1: The taker of the gift was happy.
meanings.sent2: The taker of the prize smiled with joy.
meanings.sent3: The taker of the last cookie was caught red-handed!
meanings.sent4: She was a taker of opportunities, never missing a chance.
meanings.sent5: The taker of the crown was crowned the new king.

meanings.definition: A person who accepts or receives something offered.
meanings.sent1: The taker of the invitation RSVP'd promptly.
meanings.sent2: The taker of the job offer was thrilled.
meanings.sent3: The taker of the free samples enjoyed a feast.
meanings.sent4: He was a taker of compliments, always gracious in receiving them.
meanings.sent5: The taker of the award gave a humble acceptance speech.
